answers.answer: Hi,Burning sensation under the skin may be due to nerve compression or nerve damage. The reasons could be vertebral disk problems leading to pressure on the spinal nerves,  Pressure on peripheral nerves from enlarged blood vessels, tumors, scar tissue, or infection, Shingles or herpes zoster infection, Diabetes, Migraines, Multiple sclerosis, Underactive thyroid, Raynaud's phenomenon, Abnormal levels of calcium, potassium, or sodium in your body, A lack of vitamin B12 or other vitamin, Use of certain medications, Toxic nerve damage due to lead, alcohol, or tobacco. Please consult a  neurologist as soon as possible and get MRI of the brain and spine, full body scan and nerve conduction studies done to know the cause. Hope this helps you. Take care and regards!

question: For about the last 2-3 months, I have been having excruciating burning under my skin as though I had been set on fire. It wakes me and I run to the mirror and expect to see something horrific but there isnt anything there. For about the next 30 minutes I am in alot of pain and then it goes away. This usually happens while Im asleep however it has happened a few times while awake. The burning started on my face the backs of my ears and the backs of my arms. Then about a week later it moved into my chest and remained there for sometime. I haven't had much burning over the past few weeks until lastnight. OMG I thought I was going to die, infact that is my fear, but my back was in so much pain..the burning covered the entire back. Now today Im getting little flashes of it on the back of my neck..."what is happening to me?" I am a 43 yo  female with multiple medical problems over the years and Im very afraid that this is the start of something terrible!   :(
title: Burning under my skin
